segments.key_quote: O Krishna, maintainer of the people, I have heard by disciplined succession that those who destroy family traditions dwell always in hell.
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada reads and translates Bhagavad Gita verse 1.43, emphasizing the consequences of destroying family traditions.
segments.transcript: Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya. Reading from Srimad Bhagavad Gita, Chapter 1, Observing the Armies on the Battlefield of Kuruksetra, Verse number 43: Utsanna kula-dharmāṇāṁ manuṣyāṇāṁ janārdana narake niyatam vāso bhavatīty anuśuśruma. Translation and purport by His Divine Grace A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Srila Prabhupada: O Krishna, maintainer of the people, I have heard by disciplic succession that those who destroy family traditions dwell always in hell. Purport by His Divine Grace A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Srila Prabhupada: Arjuna bases his argument not on his own personal experience but on what he has heard from the authorities; that is the way of receiving real knowledge. One cannot reach the real point of factual knowledge without being helped by the right person, one who is already established in that knowledge. There is a system in the varnasrama institution by which one has to undergo the process of ablation before death for his sinful activities. One who is always engaged in sinful activities must utilize the process of ablation, called the Prayaschitta. Without doing so, one surely will be transferred to the left path. One who is engaged in sinful activities will not be transferred to the right path. One who has been engaged in sinful activities should be transferred to hellish planets in order to undergo a miserable life as a result of sinful activities. This is Bhaktivedanta Swami Srila Prabhupada's purport. O Krishna, maintainer of the people, I have heard by disciplic succession that those who destroy family traditions dwell always in hell.
